com.yantra.api.wms.pickplanning

Interface createWaveForNode

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface createWaveForNode

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createWaveForNode(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createWaveForNode API creates waves for the passed input criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • createWaveForNode

        org.w3c.dom.Document createWaveForNode(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException
        The createWaveForNode API creates waves for the passed input criteria. This is how algorithm works:

        Eligible Shipments
        Read shipments that can be included in a wave for the node passed. Criteria for an eligible shipment:
        Shipment should be in Sent to node (1100.70) or equivalent status.
        Shipment having at least one pickable shipment line with non-zero quantity

        Effective shipment groups
        If ShipmentGroupId is passed then assign the shipment group to eligible shipments if all the conditions for the shipment group meet. If not passed, get all effective shipment groups for the node passed.If there is no shipment group configured for the node then error WMS00237: No shipment group found for the node is thrown.

        Assign shipment groups
        Assign shipment groups to read shipments in order of sequence. Refer WMS concept guide and WMS Configuration guide for more details about how shipment groups are assigned.

        Create wave
        Create waves for each shipment group. Multiple waves may be created for each shipment group due to wave size constraints.
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:


          WMSBeforeCreateWaveUE

          WMSOverrideShipmentGroupUE

        Events Raised: These events are raised under base transaction CREATE_WAVE when a wave is created otherwise events are used under base transaction MANAGE_WAVE.

        ON_SUCCESS:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of manageWave.
          Data published - WMS_MANAGE_WAVE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - wave_dbd.txt

          Template Support: Yes

          Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document the same information as the input XML. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
